message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

The paper focuses on scene recognition, which is a subfield of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel feature extraction method using a modified Convolutional Restricted Boltzmann Machines (CRBM) and a Centered Convolutional Deep Belief Networks (CCDBN), which are both machine learning techniques. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of softmax regression for scene recognition, which is a statistical method. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method using various datasets, which involves data management and analysis. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a possible sub-category.
